aim4.voronoi

Class Voronoi

  • java.lang.Object
    • aim4.voronoi.Voronoi

  • public class Voronoi
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to compute Voronoi diagrams.
    Author:
    Steven Benoit

      Generates the Voronoi diagram using Fortune's algorithm.

      java.util.Map<Vertex,java.awt.geom.Path2D> makeVoronoiPolygons(Vertex[] vertices, java.util.List<GraphEdge> edges)
      Given a list of vertices and a list of voronoi edges, computes a set of polygons, each representing a Voronoi region, then finds the vertex in that region and constructs a map from vertex to region.
      static double triArea(double xPos1, double yPos1, double xPos2, double yPos2, double xPos3, double yPos3)
      Computes twice the area of the oriented triangle (xPos1, yPos1), (xPos2, yPos2), (x3, y3) (the area is positive if the triangle is oriented counterclockwise).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Voronoi

        public Voronoi(double minSiteSpacing)
        Constructs a new Voronoi.
        Parameters:
        minSiteSpacing - the minimum distance between sites - any sites closer than this distance will be considered a single site

    • Method Detail

      • generateVoronoi

        public java.util.List<GraphEdge> generateVoronoi(Vertex[] points)
        Generates the Voronoi diagram using Fortune's algorithm.
        Parameters:
        points - an array of coordinates for each site
        Returns:
        the list of graph edges in the Voronoi diagram

      • generateBorderPolygons

        public java.util.Map<Vertex,java.awt.geom.Path2D> generateBorderPolygons(java.util.Map<Vertex,java.awt.geom.Path2D> polygons)
        Creates edges along the bounding box. Must be run after computeBounds(), makeSortedSiteList() and voronoiBuild()
        Parameters:
        polygons - a map of vertices to Path2D polygons
        Returns:
        new edges on bounding box

      • makeVoronoiPolygons

        public java.util.Map<Vertex,java.awt.geom.Path2D> makeVoronoiPolygons(Vertex[] vertices,
                                                                      java.util.List<GraphEdge> edges)
        Given a list of vertices and a list of voronoi edges, computes a set of polygons, each representing a Voronoi region, then finds the vertex in that region and constructs a map from vertex to region.
        Parameters:
        vertices - the list of vertices
        edges - the list of Voronoi edges
        Returns:
        the constructed map

      • triArea

        public static final double triArea(double xPos1,
                                   double yPos1,
                                   double xPos2,
                                   double yPos2,
                                   double xPos3,
                                   double yPos3)
        Computes twice the area of the oriented triangle (xPos1, yPos1), (xPos2, yPos2), (x3, y3) (the area is positive if the triangle is oriented counterclockwise).
        Parameters:
        xPos1 - the first point X coordinate
        yPos1 - the first point Y coordinate
        xPos2 - the second point X coordinate
        yPos2 - the second point Y coordinate
        xPos3 - the third point X coordinate
        yPos3 - the third point Y coordinate
        Returns:
        twice the oriented area

      • isCcw

        public static final boolean isCcw(double xPos1,
                                  double yPos1,
                                  double xPos2,
                                  double yPos2,
                                  double xPos3,
                                  double yPos3)
        Tests whether the points of a triangle are in counterclockwise order.
        Parameters:
        xPos1 - the first point X coordinate
        yPos1 - the first point Y coordinate
        xPos2 - the second point X coordinate
        yPos2 - the second point Y coordinate
        xPos3 - the third point X coordinate
        yPos3 - the third point Y coordinate
        Returns:
        true if triangle (xPos1, yPos1), (xPos2, yPos2), (x3, y3) is in counterclockwise order
